intro: Sida tenuicarpa, commonly known as slenderleaf sida, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in various habitats such as fields and roadsides. It has small, pale green leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. Its seeds are enclosed in small capsules, which are dispersed by wind.
